description: The German National Library is Germany's central archival library.  It collects, documents and archives all publications and sound recordings issued in Germany since 1913 together with works that were compiled in the German language or relate to Germany.  Books, journals, CDs, records, maps, online publications – we collect them all without exception, without bias and in the original.  The collection is supplemented by the holdings in the German Music Archive, the German Museum of Books and Writing and the German Exile Archive 1933–1945.
name: Deutsche National Bibliothek
